intro: Hieracium stenocoloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, and its leaves are narrow and hairy. Hieracium stenocoloides is often found in coastal areas and can thrive in poor soil conditions.
